title: Need to export specific data from bulk emails
content:
Hi - I have a batch of a few hundred emails that include names and emails from a form that people filled out. I didn't know how to create a form that collected this information directly into an email list at the time (now I do, thankfully), so now I need to download specific data - name, email - from the body all of those emails into a csv file.

I used Google Takeout to download the specific emails and then imported them into Thunderbird. I used ImportExportTools NG to export the data into a csv file, but the data I need was not included. Is there a way to export data from the body of an email into a csv file?

title: TB 115.10 Unable to turn junk filtering off -- wastes time
content:
Love the concept -- execution fails -- for me -- wastes too much time. I am unable to turn OFF junk filtering -- by unchecking the account settings box(es). Seems to happen constantly -- but several times a day -- I find several messages incorrectly moved to the junk directory / folder -- which I must highlight and then "mark as NOT junk" to get OUT of the junk folder / directory -- and back into the "inbox" (as normal email).

Just wastes TOO much time -- SO I would like to turn the whole "junk filter" -- MOVING EMAILS TO THE JUNK DIRECTORY -- OFF (until the filtering improves -- and I can tell it "that IS" junk while it is still in the "inbox" -- with a single click (the "flame" icon).

I love the (though it NEEDS "AI") junk / spam concept -- but with fully exposed (viewable / editable?) premises of what criteria constitutes "junk" (spam) -- or NOT -- to me -- for my purposes ("trained"). However would love the "junk" (spam) system to connect with a common database of KNOWN spam messages (and move those to the junk directory).

Thanks,

Dru
creator: druw

title: How to stop "Login to account xxxx failed" error popup?
content:
I'm looking for a setting to turn off/disable/suppress this error popup and can't find it.

Every morning I wake up and find 1-4 of these error popups on my screen. This only started happening after I switched to Windows 10 with a new version of Thunderbird (102.13).

It may be a connection issue, which I doubt, or it may be a server issue, which I doubt, but in either case the message is irrelevant; the login credentials ARE correct and will resolve to collect email immediately. For whatever reason it just throws an error randomly throughout the day. If I'm at the computer and get one of these, I can immediately retrieve all my email in Thunderbird without error, so this is an annoyance not an impediment.

How do I turn off this "feature?" Keep in mind that Thunderbird automatically retries every 5 minutes and it goes through, or I can do it manually just seconds after the error, so this is a false error to begin with. I'm not looking for a solution to the supposed "failed" authentication, just a way to suppress these message popups.
creator: uberphlubb

title: More "granularity needed" to "How to turn off Junk filtering / TB 115.10
content:
Does not "appear" to fundamentally address my question -- but perhaps with more granularity to :How".

I do not believe the "server" of the Hosting company (Hostinger) is moving email to my "junk" directory / folder -- but tell me more. How exactly do I -- "Access the account in webmail" -- and what is "webmail" (who? what server" accessed how?) Is that Hostinger? For this to occur it would seem that "my hosting company (Hostinger) would need to be aware of TB and the existence of a named "junk" directory (OR is there generic language / coding to "derive" the existence of a "junk" folder in TB or an equivalent directory in ALL email clients?

Is there yet anyway to "connect" all similar questions -- and all similar answers (using "AI"?) to find and fully parse out those needed "details" to somehow avoid wasting significant time "marking as not junk" so many normal emails -- no "white list" wanted as most are not from known senders.

Thanks,

Dru
creator: druw

title: No recibo los mensajes y tampoco los puedo enviar
content:
Saludos,

Tengo el problema que mi correo electrónico desde hace unos días no recibe los mensajes y tampoco me permite enviarlos. Al interntar enviar un mensaje dice el siguiente mensaje: "Falló el envio del mensaje. El mensaje no se ha podido enviar porque ha caducado la conexión al servidir de salida (SMTP) mail.hospiciodeloeste.com. Vuelva a intentarlo."

Cuando verifico los ajustes del sistema de Thunderbird, dice que la aplicación está al día. Al igual que cuando me dirijo a la plataforma del dominio: hospiciodeloeste.com, puedo ver que todos los mensajes recibidos a dicho correo electrónico están llegando correctamente; pero en la aplicación de Thunderbird no suben los correos. Hoy probé instalar el correo electrónico en otra aplicación de correo electrónico y recibió los mensajes que nos enviaron durante el día.

¿Alguna sugerencia al respecto?

Gracias.
creator: ptorresfacturador

title: Rules for Sub-Sub folders
content:
Example:

I have created a sub folder for my bank (Banking) all mail goes there that is from the banks domain.

After that there is secondary sub folder for card usage receipts, transaction reports; my bank sends me one every time I use my card so I get a ton of these which I don't want to clog up the important mail from the bank, statements, transfers, etc.

I have tried creating a rule for the transaction receipts by subject but this conflicts with the primary rule of the banking folder because they use the domain address. The mail just bounces between the two folders.

How do I create filter a to run on solely on the Banking sub folder to redirect the transaction junk to it's own folder?
